article_title: Does More Health Spending Mean Better Health?

article_metadata.author: Walker Ray, MD and Tim Norbeck

og.description: The first question one must ask is: Are we spending too much or too little on healthcare? Interestingly, there are multiple answers to this question depending on whether the spending is for basic healthcare services, reducing mortality and morbidity, improving the quality of life or increasing the longevity of the population.
